metadata.titleEn: Apatite and zircon geochemical data of  Luoboling porphyry Cu–Mo deposit in Zijinshan mineralization field
metadata.description: The data are zircon in-situ trace element, Hf isotope and U-Pb dating data, and apatite in-situ major (including F, Cl) and trace element geochemical data of ore bearing rocks and surrounding rocks of Luobuling porphyry Cu-Mo deposit in Zijinshan mineralization field, Fujian Province. The lithology of the samples includes biotite granodiorite porphyry (LBL20-01), granodiorite porphyry (LBL20-02, LBL22-02), porphyritic granodiorite (Zhongliao pluton, LBL22-03) and granodiorite (Sifang pluton, SF09-05). Zircon in-situ Lu-Hf isotopic data, U-Pb isotopic dating data and trace element data were obtained by LA-ICP-MS analysis. Apatite major (including F, Cl) and trace element data were obtained by EMPA and LA-ICP-MS analysis, respectively. The above data have been published in high-level SCI journals, and the data are true and reliable. Through the data obtained, we can further study the genesis, tectonic setting and evolution process of the Zijinshan porphyry-epithermal ore system.
metadata.instructions: All data are stored in Excel file and can be opened directly in Excel workbook. The file named "Zrn_UPb" file represents the U-Pb isotopic composition of zircon, "Zrn_Tra" stands for zircon trace element data, "Zrn_Hf" represents the Hf isotopic data of zircon," Ap_FClMaj" represents the data of major elements (including F and Cl) of apatite, "Ap_Tra" represents apatite trace element data.

authorList.unitEn: Institute of Oceanology, Chinese Academy of Sciences

literatureList.titleEn: The formation of Luoboling porphyry Cu–Mo deposit: Constraints from zircon and apatite.
literatureList.referenceEn: Li, C. Y., Hao, X. L., Liu, J. Q., Ling, M. X., Ding, X., Zhang, H., & Sun, W. D. (2017). The formation of Luoboling porphyry Cu–Mo deposit: Constraints from zircon and apatite. Lithos, 272, 291-300.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of data collection methods used to obtain geochemical data from mineral deposits, specifically focusing on zircon and apatite analysis?
Example.Answer: One data collection method involves using LA-ICP-MS (Laser Ablation Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry) to obtain in-situ trace element, Hf isotope, and U-Pb dating data from zircon samples. Similarly, EMPA (Electron Microprobe Analysis) and LA-ICP-MS are used to gather major element (including F, Cl) and trace element geochemical data from apatite samples. These methods are employed to analyze rock samples such as biotite granodiorite porphyry and granodiorite porphyry, allowing researchers to study the genesis, tectonic setting, and evolution of porphyry-epithermal mineralization systems.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of the geochemical data collection methods used for zircon and apatite in porphyry copper-molybdenum deposits?
Feature Specification.Answer: in-situ analysis of trace elements, Hf isotopes, U-Pb dating for zircon, major elements (including F, Cl) for apatite, LA-ICP-MS for isotopic and elemental analysis, EMPA for major elements, LA-ICP-MS for trace elements

Definition.Question: What does 'LA-ICP-MS analysis' mean in the context of geochemical data collection?
Definition.Answer: LA-ICP-MS analysis refers to Laser Ablation Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry, a technique used for obtaining in-situ micro-scale geochemical data. In the context of geochemical data collection, it is used to analyze zircon and apatite minerals to acquire isotopic data, such as Lu-Hf and U-Pb isotopes, as well as trace element compositions, which are essential for understanding mineral genesis, tectonic settings, and evolutionary processes of mineral systems.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors contribute to the choice of LA-ICP-MS and EMPA as data collection methods for zircon and apatite geochemical analysis in porphyry copper-molybdenum deposits?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: LA-ICP-MS and EMPA are chosen for zircon and apatite geochemical analysis in porphyry copper-molybdenum deposits due to their ability to provide precise in-situ microanalysis. LA-ICP-MS is effective for obtaining zircon U-Pb isotopic dating and Lu-Hf isotopic data, as well as trace element concentrations, which are crucial for understanding the geological history and mineralization processes. EMPA is used to analyze the major elements in apatite, including F and Cl, offering insights into the mineral's formation conditions and the fluid characteristics involved in the mineralization process.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the primary objective of collecting in-situ zircon and apatite geochemical data for understanding the porphyry copper-molybdenum mineralization processes in the Zijinshan ore field?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objective of collecting in-situ zircon and apatite geochemical data is to further study the genesis, tectonic setting, and evolution processes of the Zijinshan porphyry-epithermal mineralization system. This involves analyzing zircon trace elements, Hf isotopes, and U-Pb dating data, as well as apatite major and trace element geochemical data, to gain insights into the mineralization processes.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures and instruments are involved in collecting in-situ zircon trace elements, Hf isotopes, U-Pb dating, and apatite geochemistry data in porphyry copper-molybdenum deposits?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The procedures for collecting in-situ zircon trace elements, Hf isotopes, U-Pb dating, and apatite geochemistry data involve using LA-ICP-MS (Laser Ablation Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry) for zircon trace elements, Lu-Hf isotopes, and U-Pb isotopic dating. Additionally, EMPA (Electron Microprobe Analysis) and LA-ICP-MS are used to obtain major (including F, Cl) and trace element geochemistry data for apatite. These methods ensure precise and accurate measurement of elemental concentrations and isotopic compositions in the samples from the porphyry copper-molybdenum deposits.
